::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M1.9 Upwelling zones**](/efg-info/M1_9.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/M1_9_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: M1.9.web.orig v1.0.

> Marine ecoregions (Spalding et al. 2008) with major and minor occurrences of Upwelling zones were identified by consulting global and regional reviews (cited in descriptive profile), maps of relevant ecosystems and expertise of authors, proofed by specialist reviewers. The identified ecoregions were then clipped to the extent of the marine ‘shelf’ base layer as mapped by Harris et al. (2014b). Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**GSFM-2014** (Harris PT et al. 2014):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (subsets).

 **MEOW-2008** (Spalding MD et al.  2008):

Source of _biogeographical range_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|:---------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

|MEOW-2008 |<https://www.worldwildlife.org/publications/marine-ecoregions-of-the-world-a-bioregionalization-of-coastal-and-shelf-areas>{target='links'} :: <https://databasin.org/datasets/3b6b12e7bcca419990c9081c0af254a2>{target='links'} :: <http://maps.tnc.org/gis_data.html>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Thresholds* :: *Clipping* :: *Selection*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _no_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Qualitative expert assessment,undocumented*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: M1.9.web.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M1.9.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**M1.9.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.9.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090941){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/M1.9.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/M1.9.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](M1.9.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**M1.9.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.9.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Harris PT, Macmillan-Lawler M, Rupp J, Baker EK (2014) *Geomorphology of the oceans*. **Marine Geology** 352: 4-24. [10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011) 
 - Spalding MD, Fox HE, Allen GR, Davidson N, Ferdaña ZA, Finlayson M, Halpern BS, Jorge MA, Lombana A, Lourie SA, Martin KD, McManus E, Molnar J, Recchia CA, Robertson J (2007) *Marine ecoregions of the world: a bioregionalization of coastal and shelf areas*. **Bioscience** 57: 573–583.
